thread.title: Minnesota startups widen net for investors
thread.title_full: Minnesota startups widen net for investors

author: Karlee Weinmann
title: Minnesota startups widen net for investors
text:
Home / News / Economic Development / Minnesota startups widen net for investors Bryn Mawr Brewing Co. cofounder Dan Justesen shows the forthcoming breweryâ€™s space, at 225 Thomas Ave. N. in Minneapolis. With a lease in place, Justesen said it was time to launch a fundraising campaign using less restrictive federal securities rules that allow the brewery to advertise to accredited investors. (Staff photo: Bill Klotz) Minnesota startups widen net for investors By: Karlee Weinmann August 11, 2015 7:04 am 0 Some budding business owners are turning to an alternative to MNvest that still hinges on accredited investors but can substantially expand the pool.
